title: Paul Smith uses dad’s photography to inspire Paris fashion week show
description: Intimate, eccentric show launches set of modern pieces made with traditional techniques and vintage touchesPaul Smith regularly takes inspiration from his travels but for his latest collection, shown in Paris on Wednesday afternoon, he stuck a little closer to home.The amateur photography collection of his dad, Harold B Smith, served as his starting point. Guests entered the venue through a mocked-up dark room complete with buckets of emulsion, strung-up negatives and a stainless steel sink. A booklet featuring some of the work of Smith senior, a founding member of the Beeston camera club in Nottinghamshire, was left on each seat. Continue reading...
author: Chloe Mac Donnell

title: Primark launches clothing range designed for people with disabilities
description: Range of womenswear and menswear contains 49 pieces adapted from brand’s bestselling items to suit variety of needsIt’s a go-to shop for cheap knickers and designer dupes, but now Primark hopes to become the top destination for clothing designed for those with a range of disabilities.In a first for the budget high street shop, it is releasing a 49-piece line of womenswear and menswear, adapted from its bestselling items to suit a range of needs. Continue reading...
author: Lucy Webster

title: My Brother and Sister-in-Law No Longer Want to Put Me Up. I’m Hurt!
description: A reader feels stung by her brother and his wife’s cooling to an idea that they had once seemed open to: hosting her once a month when she commutes to a faraway office job.

description: As a new generation seeks out vintage Armani on eBay, the label is leaning into its own archive. The Armani renaissance is officially on.

title: Keep The Cold At Bay With The Trendiest Winter Jackets & Coats For Women
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. Winter jackets are practical, but the best ones aren’t a supporting act — they’re the main character, serving as the outfit. That’s why we’re all about layering up in outerwear that delivers warmth and wow factor. Whether you’re leaning into the coziness of a sherpa coat or the sporty edge of a puffer, the right winter topper can transform even the simplest look into a moment. This season, the top coat is getting a modern twist with ladylike details and cape silhouettes, while wintry leather and suede jackets hold their ground (though not without fresh updates, from vibrant colors to bold faux-fur trims). Bombers are vying for the spotlight, too, feeling particularly on-point in warmer winter climates. And if you’re in need of a warm layer to drape over your winter wedding guest attire? Look no further than the faux-fur coats topping our edit (Topshop’s, Gap’s, and Abercrombie’s are incredible). As far as specific items go, fan favorites like the Aritzia slouch coat, the North Face puffer, and the teddy-like UGG coat prove that staying warm doesn’t mean compromising on style. Whether you’re bundling up, keeping it tailored, or planning outcoats to pair with your coziest oversized scarf, our picks ahead make braving the cold downright fun. DashDividers_1_500x100 Faux-Fur Coats Nothing says winter glamour like a faux-fur coat. From Topshop’s hip-grazing silhouette to Gap’s best-selling knee-length style, these jackets balance boldness with cozy comfort. They’re perfect for pairing with denim or a sweater dress to dress up the casual winter staples. DashDividers_1_500x100 Suede Jackets Suede jackets are stepping it up with fun, vibrant shades this winter, like Free People’s rust red rendition and Urban Outfitters’ cobalt blue style. A classic refreshed for those who like their layers heavyweight and punched up with a little more personality. DashDividers_1_500x100 Puffer Jackets The puffer jacket is a winter essential that’s equal parts cozy and cool. From North Face’s iconic 1996 Retro Nuptse to Coach’s cute (and reversible!) cropped design, these go with everything, from comfy travel pants to date-night looks (or sweats when you’re keeping it lounge-y for weekend errands). Fully lean into the vibe with coordinating puffer boots.  DashDividers_1_500x100 Leather Coats Leather coats are a closet mainstay for a reason: They do the most (in a good way). Plush-lined styles (like Asos Curve’s long silhouette lined with shearling) bring serious warmth for frigid days, while lightweight options (like BDG’s fur-trimmed aviator) are just the thing for milder temps. DashDividers_1_500x100 Sherpa Coats Sherpa coats bring a plush, textural twist to cold-weather layering. From statement designs like Damson Madder’s checked and bow-adorned jacket to timeless teddy silhouettes like UGG’s Gertrude and J.Crew’s winter-white peacoat, they’re ideal for adding warmth and a fun touch to your winter wardrobe.  DashDividers_1_500x100 Ladylike Wool Coats Curved lines, sharp collars, and sleek details give classic wool coats a fresh spin this season. Look at Reformation’s bow-tied jacket or Madewell’s bold red design — they’re ladylike, minimal, and anything but boring (especially if you go bold by styling yours alongside the dress-over pants trend).  DashDividers_1_500x100 Bomber Jackets Bomber jackets are getting a sport-luxe makeover with padded and quilted designs (perfect for brisk chills), slouchy faux leather (bonus points for trendy colors like burgundy), and even reversible options (who doesn’t love a two-fer?). Style them over clingy knits with jeans and a statement belt for an “I tried, but not too hard” nonchalance. DashDividers_1_500x100 Cape Coats Cape coats are one of those runway trends that are actually wearable IRL. From Dôen’s plaid take to Banana Republic’s bright red number (hitting two trends at once), these styles deliver drama with a polished sensibility. Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?The Best Winter Dress Trends To Wear On RepeatBundle Up In These 11 Cozy Puffer JacketsHoliday Party Dresses For Winter Celebrations
author: Jinnie Lee

title: Oversized Scarves Are Our Go-To Winter Accessory (Sorry Beanies & Gloves)
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. Beanies? Gloves? Sure, they’re wardrobe essentials when the wind chill intensifies, and your coffee cools down faster than you can sip it. But on the winter fashion scale, they’re pretty basic. Scarves, on the other hand, are anything but. These winter accessories have range and can transform an outfit with minimal effort. From patterned and colorful designs to luxe cashmere and wool fabrications and even hooded silhouettes, they’re the MVPs of cold-weather dressing. But if there’s one type that consistently steals the spotlight (and keeps us the coziest), it’s the oversized scarf — the stylishly and borderline excessive piece that turns bundling up into an art form. This season, brands are doubling down on the trend, offering everything from ultra-plush styles made from faux fur and teddy-like shearling to fuzzy brushed alpaca and vibrant, ribbed silhouettes that rival your favorite throw. So, instead of splurging on yet another pair of forgettable gloves or a one-size-fits-all beanie, opt for an oversized scarf — it’s a budget-friendly way to embrace the scarf coat trend without committing to (or investing in) the full look. Keep scrolling to shop 24 of the season’s best options for every style and sensibility — you’ll be covered, both literally and sartorially. Oversized Scarves: Brushed A brushed scarf is all about adding a touchable, cozy texture to your look. Offered in mainstay neutrals and playful colors or prints, these scarves bring ultimate warmth with a classic sensibility. Oversized Scarves: Cashmere Soft, oversized, and luxe, cashmere scarves are a timeless winter must-have. Whether you go for a neutral, graphic whipstich detailing, or a pastel hue, these babies bring coziness and polish to any cold-weather outfit. Oversized Scarves: Fleece-y Feels Fleece scarves are the ultimate in cuddle-worthy, from timeless wraps to trendy hooded designs à la Free People’s rust-red version. They bring a plush, modern touch while delivering mega warmth. Oversized Scarves: Fringe We love a bit of drama — when it comes to fashion, at least. Long, exaggerated tassels are the perfect way to refresh this classic winter accessory, adding movement and a bold finish to any winter look. Oversized Scarves: Faux Fur Shearling, faux fur, and shaggy textures bring a whole new dimension of softness. These scarves are a tactile treat, begging to be touched. Layer them over sleek silhouettes for a refined contrast, or lean fully into the snug vibes with matching textured pieces as seen above. Oversized Scarves: Ribbed Ribbed scarves bring a chunky feel and add personality to your winter lineup. From pastel wool to bold cashmere blends, these styles add texture while feeling like your coziest blanket.  Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?The Best Gloves For Winter, Hands DownThese Are The 32 Trendiest Winter Coats & JacketsHow To Style Knee-High Boots For Every Occasion
author: Eliza Huber

title: 3 Editors Test Drive Quince's Affordable Leather Jackets
description: When it comes to fashion, whether you're minimalist, maximalist, or something entirely in between, there's one staple item you need in your wardrobe: a leather jacket. It's truly the Swiss army knife of clothing. There are plenty of different styles to choose from, including oversize, cropped, and motorcycle - just to name a few. You can dress it up or down, and whether you're wearing it for a date or throwing it on for a quick grocery store run, there's nothing like a well-worn leather jacket that is perfectly you. However, finding a high-quality leather jacket at a price that won't break the bank is no easy feat. Luckily, we think we found a brand that checks all of our boxes and has something for everyone, no matter what style you're seeking. Allow us to introduce you to Quince. Quince is all about offering high-quality items made with premium materials at an affordable price. How do they do it? The direct-to-consumer brand uses a factory-direct model and keeps costs low by cutting out the supply-chain middlemen. They make home and travel products, but right now, our editors couldn't be more obsessed with their leather jackets. Ahead, three editors put three different styles of Quince's 100-percent leather jackets to the test. You can check us out modeling different options, read about how they worked for us, and then use our tips to help you make your own purchase - we promise you won't regret it. Keep scrolling to read our honest thoughts.
author: Renee Rodriguez

title: 10 Nordstrom Winter Staples, From Water-Resistant Boots to Cropped Sweaters
